intro: Senecio pennellii, commonly known as the Pennell's groundsel, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in coastal areas. It produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in spring, followed by fluffy, white seeds. Senecio pennellii is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its delicate appearance and ability to thrive in well-drained conditions.
